bill.title: A resolution to provide for related procedures concerning the articles of impeachment against Donald John Trump, President of the United States.
bill.description: This resolution sets forth the rules governing the final arguments and vote regarding the articles of impeachment against President Trump.

history.action: Measure laid before Senate. (consideration: CR S767-769)
S.Amdt.1295 Amendment SA 1295 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S767; text: CR S769-771) To subpoena certain relevant witnesses and documents.
S.Amdt.1295 Motion to table amendment SA 1295 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 28.
S.Amdt.1296 Amendment SA 1296 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S767-768; text: CR S771) To subpoena John Robert Bolton.
S.Amdt.1296 Motion to table amendment SA 1296 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 49. Record Vote Number: 29.
S.Amdt.1297 Amendment SA 1297 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S768; text: CR S771-772) To subpoena John Robert Bolton.
S.Amdt.1297 Motion to table amendment SA 1297 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 49. Record Vote Number: 30.

S.Amdt.1298 Amendment SA 1298 proposed by Senator Van Hollen. (consideration: CR S768-769; text: CR S772) To help ensure impartial justice by requiring the Chief Justice of the United States to rule on motions to subpoena witnesses and documents and issues of privilege.
S.Amdt.1298 Motion to table amendment SA 1298 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 31.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 32. (text: CR S769)

subjects.subject_name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption
Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents
